refnamediv.refpurpose: Generates a compact, storable binary representation of a value

refentry.refsect1:
&reftitle.description;
stringmsgpack_serialize mixedvalue
Generates a storable representation of a value.
This is useful for storing or passing PHP values around without losing their type and structure.

&reftitle.parameters;
value
The value to be serialized. msgpack_serialize handles all types, except the resource-type and some objects (see note below). Even &array;s that contain references to itself can be processed by msgpack_serialize. Circular references inside the &array; or &object; that is being serialized will also be stored. Any other reference will be lost.
When serializing objects, msgpack will attempt to call the member functions __serialize() or __sleep() prior to serialization. This is to allow the object to do any last minute clean-up, etc. prior to being serialized. Likewise, when the object is restored using msgpack_unserialize the __unserialize() or __wakeup() member function is called.
Private members of &object;s have the class name prepended to the member name; protected members have a '*' prepended to the member name. These prepended values have null bytes on either side.

&reftitle.returnvalues;
Returns a string containing a byte-stream representation of value that can be stored anywhere.
Note that this is a binary string which can include any byte value, and needs to be stored and handled as such. For example, msgpack_serialize output should generally be stored in a BLOB field in a database, rather than a CHAR or TEXT field.
Returns an empty string on error.
